_header: I have a lady whereso she be
_description: ‘The Discryuyng of a fayre lady‘: a mock courtly panegyric of traditional charms — seven stanzas rhyme royal

CamTCC599.First Lines:
[I] haue a lady where so she beThat seldom ys the souerayn of my
                    thought…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…That furst hytr formyd to be a creatureffor were she wele of
                    me I dyd no cure
CamTCC599.Attributed Author:
by Chaucer (right margin, beside line 1, f. 205, by a later
                    hand)
CamTCC599.Attributed Title:
Explicit the Dyscryuyng of a fayre lady (f.
                    205v)
